definition: calm/poised
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: The food tasted rather bland, so he added some spices to pep it up a little.
sentences.chinese: 这食品太乏味，于是他加了一些调料提提味。

sentences.english: When it comes to how a page looks, at best you're only able to make suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 说到页面的外观，顶多您只能提提建议。

sentences.english: Will you flavor the cake with chocolate?
sentences.chinese: 请你在蛋糕里加点巧克力提提味。

sentences.english: It was enough to get Nefertiti out of the country into Germany.
sentences.chinese: 这足以把纳芙提提带出到德国。

sentences.english: Like their ancestors, women winnow grain by hand near Lake Titicaca.
sentences.chinese: 和先辈一样，提提卡卡湖附近的女性还是用手扬谷子。

sentences.english: After the interview, I e-mailed the woman to apologize and to ask for advice.
sentences.chinese: 访谈过后，我给那位女士写了道歉信，问她提提意见。

sentences.english: The refreshment of Randalls was absolutely necessary.
sentences.chinese: 到兰多尔斯去提提神，这是绝对必要的。

sentences.english: It's necessary for us to be constantly reminded of our shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 有必要让人经常提提我们的缺点。

sentences.english: Because after all, is the most Hou Titi comedy funny, so very dramatic film.
sentences.chinese: 最后提提由于毕竟是喜剧搞笑，所以片子戏剧性很强。

sentences.english: I want something to cheer me up.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一点什么东西来提提神。
